content.description: This is an obvious ramp on the Dune boulder. This is the down climb/Veasy climb for the boulder plenty of other lines on the slab face.This is a decent sized boulder that has a very large obvious 20inch ramp that starts at about hip height (3~ft)Pull the ledge and then step up the short safe ramp.
content.location: go about 25 min into the canyon and you'll pass a potential wall area with undeveloped boulders and you'll see along section of the canyon with roughly one boulder on the "left" (looking deeper in to the canyon) You'll know you've hit the boulder when you see the very nice sharp ramp about 20inch wide on the boulder.

content.description:
I would of graded this lower than V5 but the start holds are rather small and the balance required to get on the boulder was unique so I felt the grade was appropriate. 

 Also the Holds are Super Slick though there are rather deep (two pad) crimps along the ridge. Lastly the overhanging nature of this climb gave it the rating since the feet are hard to utilize and then top out with very little feet to work with. Currently has a wonderful landing zone that is level.
content.location: up the canyon from Armored-dillo this is about a 14min hike into the canyon from the entrance to the canyon and past a few "blockages" You'll know when you're there since the boulder is smack dab in the middle of this opened up area. There's other boulders to claim.

content.description: This is a fairly straight forward climb. It has very smooth holds but the pockets are deep and the angel starts off nice. Good landing for the pads.
content.location: Start from the ground on large hole and move up the pocket/crack system.

content.description:
This is a very unique canyon with tons and tons of potential. There is also potential for bolted lines but none have been established at this time.    This was pretty Hot in mid October so be wary if going out side of winter season.  

  Other wise the lines, boulders, and adventure are totally worth it especially if you link this up with the upstream area Burro Canyon.  

  There are four or five possible climbing locations but only three established lines. Open season for first accents.
